documentType: Bureau of Prisons medical and incident reports
summary: This document contains Bureau of Prisons medical records, staff memoranda, and assignment rosters detailing the medical emergency response and death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It includes clinical notes from resuscitation attempts, staff accounts of the incident, and post-incident assignments. This document consists of multiple photo sheet forms from the Metropolitan Correctional Center documenting the suicide of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019, and a subsequent financial report showing money sent from Epstein's account. The photo sheets repeatedly record the time, location, and personnel involved in documenting the incident. This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons records for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, covering his incarceration at the New York Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) from July to August 2019. It includes commissary sales invoices, administrative detention orders, housing assignments, inmate detail reports, medical intake forms, and a log of attorney visits and court appearances. This document is a compilation of Bureau of Prisons health services records for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, covering the period from July 7, 2019, to August 10, 2019. It includes detailed medical assessments, vital signs, medication administration records, diagnoses, and treatment plans from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The records document his chronic health conditions and medical care prior to his death. This document contains Bureau of Prisons health services records for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, covering medical encounters, dental screenings, lab results, and medication orders from July to August 2019 at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It details his medical history, physical exams, and prescribed treatments in the weeks leading up to his death. This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons medical records for inmate Jeffrey Epstein from July 2019, detailing lab results, clinical encounters, and injury reports in the weeks leading up to his death. It includes notes on a neck injury, refusal of an eye exam, and reports of numbness and neuropathy. This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons medical records for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, covering the period from July to August 2019. It includes lab results, treatment refusal forms, dental examinations, and clinical encounter notes detailing his health complaints and the emergency response to his cardiac arrest on August 10, 2019. This document contains Bureau of Prisons medical records for Jeffrey Epstein from July 2019, detailing a neck injury incident and subsequent medical evaluations, followed by call detail records (CDRs) showing multiple 'BARGE REQUEST' calls on August 9, 2019. The medical notes document an injury where Epstein was found with a rope around his neck and was placed on suicide watch. This document is a detailed telephone call log from August 9, 2019, showing 52 call records. The log includes technical call data such as caller station numbers, timestamps, and call statuses, with many calls dialing the number '003'. The document appears to be a record of phone activity, potentially from a detention or correctional facility, given the 'BARGE REQUEST' call status and repeated dialing pattern. This document is a detailed telephone call log from August 9, 2019, showing a series of short-duration calls with a status of 'BARGE REQUEST' and a dialed number of '003'. It appears to be a record of internal or monitored phone activity, possibly from a detention or correctional facility, given the repeated 'BARGE' status and specific station/circuit identifiers. This document is a detailed telephone call log from a correctional facility, showing a series of very short-duration calls (mostly 1-2 seconds) made on August 9-10, 2019. The calls are all of type 'ONE LINE' and status 'BARGE REQUEST', suggesting they may be automated system checks, monitoring attempts, or failed connection attempts within the facility's phone system. This document is a detailed telephone call log from August 10-11, 2019, showing numerous short-duration calls with a status of 'BARGE REQUEST' dialing to number '003'. It appears to be a record of automated or system-initiated calls, likely from a detention or correctional facility, given the timing and repetitive nature. This document is a telephone call log from August 11, 2019, showing numerous calls made to a dialed number '003'. The log records technical details like caller station numbers, timestamps, and call statuses (BARGE REQUEST). It appears to be a record of phone activity, potentially from a detention facility or institution, on the day Jeffrey Epstein died. This document appears to be a fragment of a telephone call log or system audit record from August 11, 2019, showing technical details of call connections, including timestamps, circuit IDs, routing classes, and call statuses like 'BARGE REQUEST'. It is part of a larger set of records related to the Epstein case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of all records, incarcerated at the New York MCC on charges of sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors. Records detail his commissary purchases, housing assignments, medical intake, and administrative status.

persons.name: T. Noel
persons.context: Officer who announced the medical emergency on 9 South and stated to a lieutenant that inmate Epstein had hung himself. Also noted that 3am and 5am rounds were not completed.

persons.name: M. Thomas
persons.context: Officer performing life-saving CPR on inmate Epstein when the lieutenant arrived. Appeared distraught and stated 'we messed up' and 'we didn't do any rounds.'

persons.name: K. Cale
persons.context: Escort officer #2 who followed the EMS ambulance in the BOP chase vehicle to Beekman Hospital.

persons.name: Grijalva
persons.context: Staff member who passed on information on August 9, 2019, that inmate Epstein would need a cellmate upon return from his attorney visit.

persons.name: M/S Shakir
persons.context: Present shift staff member who received information about inmate Epstein needing a cellmate.

persons.name: Joyner, P
persons.context: Officer listed on the staff assignment roster and mentioned as receiving information about inmate Epstein needing a cellmate.

persons.name: Richardson, O
persons.context: Officer listed on the staff assignment roster.

persons.name: Shen, T
persons.context: Staff member listed on the staff assignment roster.

persons.name: Reyes
persons.context: Inmate #85993-054 who was going to WAS (possibly work assignment) and might not return, affecting cell assignment for Epstein.

persons.name: N. Reid

Staff member Grijalva passed information about Epstein needing a cellmate after his attorney visit.
Epstein sent $200 to Efrain Reyes via Western Union on August 7, 2019, according to prison financial records.
Epstein sent $200 to Ruben Rugard via Western Union on July 8, 2019, according to prison financial records.

Indyke sent $300 to Epstein's inmate trust fund in July 2019.
Kahn sent $200 to Epstein's inmate trust fund in July 2019.

Epstein was under the medical care of physician 'MD', who prescribed medications and ordered treatments for conditions like constipation.

DDS performed Epstein's dental examination and health screening, identifying issues like gingival recession.

Epstein was examined and treated by Dr. Robert for medical complaints including right arm numbness and lack of medication.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive in Cell
events.description: At approximately 6:33 AM, a medical emergency was announced for inmate Jeffrey Epstein in cell Z06-220 on L-tier in the Special Housing Unit. He was found on the floor unresponsive with bruising around the neck, and CPR was initiated.

events.title: Resuscitation Attempt and Transport
events.description: CPR was performed continuously by officers and medical staff. EMS arrived, intubated Epstein, administered medications, and transported him to a local ER (Beekman Hospital) with CPR still in progress. He was later pronounced dead.

events.title: Epstein's Social Call
events.description: On the evening of August 9, Epstein was escorted to make a social phone call to his family, specifically mentioning calling his mother. His attorney visitation was shortened to accommodate this call.

events.title: Cellmate Planning
events.description: Staff passed information that inmate Epstein would need a cellmate upon his return from his attorney visit, indicating he was not in a single cell at that time.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Suicide
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, with the incident classified as an inmate suicide.

events.title: Money Transfer to Efrain Reyes
events.description: A $200 Western Union money transfer was sent from inmate Jeffrey Epstein's account to Efrain Reyes.

events.title: Money Transfer to Ruben Rugard
events.description: A $200 Western Union money transfer was sent from inmate Jeffrey Epstein's account to Ruben Rugard.

events.title: Epstein admitted to New York MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was admitted to the New York Metropolitan Correctional Center as a pre-sentenced adult inmate.

events.title: Court appearance
events.description: Epstein had a court appearance in the Southern District of New York with a scheduled return.

events.title: Medical intake examination
events.description: Epstein underwent a medical intake examination by an MLP (Mid-Level Practitioner). He reported a history of constipation and was prescribed medication.

events.title: Placed in Administrative Detention
events.description: An administrative detention order was issued for Epstein, citing 'pending classification' and stating his presence in general population posed a serious threat.

events.title: Hospital transport
events.description: Epstein was transported from the MCC to a hospital with a scheduled return to US Marshals custody.

events.title: Initial Health Assessment
events.description: Epstein underwent an initial health assessment at the MCC, recording vitals, height, weight, and patient education assessment.

events.title: Chronic Care Physician Evaluation
events.description: Epstein had a detailed clinical encounter for chronic care evaluation, addressing hyperlipidemia, sleep apnea, back pain, and neuralgia. A Medrol dose pack was prescribed for pain.

events.title: Injury Assessment
events.description: Medical record notes an 'Injury, unspecified' with 'R/O self inflicted injuries' (rule out self-inflicted injuries).

events.title: CPAP Machine Issued and Diet Restriction Noted
events.description: A CPAP machine was issued to Epstein for his sleep apnea, and a diet restriction for fish allergies was formally documented.

events.title: Medical Records Generated for Transfer
events.description: A comprehensive set of medical records, including vitals, problems, medications, and transfer information, was generated, indicating preparation for a potential transfer.

events.title: Epstein's Initial Health Assessment
events.description: A comprehensive history and physical exam performed by MLP at MCC New York, documenting Epstein's medical history, vital signs, and social history including travel and sexual history.

events.title: Medication Change for Constipation
events.description: Epstein requested and was prescribed docusate sodium (Colace) instead of bisacodyl for constipation, with the order cosigned by Robert MD.

events.title: Dental Health Screening
events.description: Epstein underwent a dental assessment revealing moderate to advanced upper posterior gingival recession, lower anterior crowding, and a history of treated chlamydia in 2015.

events.title: CPAP Machine and Insulin Orders
events.description: Medical duty status records indicate a CPAP machine was issued for sleep apnea, and insulin orders were prescribed, suggesting management of diabetic or hyperglycemic conditions.

events.title: Epstein Found with Neck Injury
events.description: Epstein was found in his cell (Special Housing Unit Z05 - Cell 124) with a rope around his neck, sitting on the floor. He reported waking up 'snorting' and had circular erythema (redness) on his neck. He was placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Epstein Refuses Eye Doctor Evaluation
events.description: Epstein signed a Bureau of Prisons form refusing the recommended 'Eye Doctor Evaluation' treatment.

events.title: Epstein Implicates Cellmate in Injury
events.description: During a medical follow-up, Epstein stated, 'I think my room mate had to do with what happened to me,' referring to the neck injury, but refused to elaborate further.

events.title: Epstein Reports Neuropathy and Arm Numbness
events.description: Epstein reported to medical staff that he woke up with no control over his right arm for a few minutes and later reported persistent 'pins and needles' in his right hand.

events.title: Epstein's Laboratory Tests
events.description: Blood was collected from Epstein for hematology and serology tests, including an HIV test (which was negative). Results showed elevated hemoglobin A1C (6.3, indicating increased diabetes risk).

events.title: Epstein Refuses Chest X-Ray
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein signed a medical treatment refusal form, declining a routine chest X-ray recommended by BOP medical staff.

events.title: Medical Counseling and Lab Tests
events.description: Epstein was counseled by MD Robert Beaudouin regarding lab tests (hepatitis profile, etc.) and verbally confirmed understanding.

events.title: Chronic Care Evaluation
events.description: Epstein was evaluated in the chronic care clinic. He reported being without his medications for a week, numbness in his right arm, sleep issues due to lack of a CPAP machine, and various other health complaints.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive - Cardiac Arrest
events.description: Correctional officers responded to a body alarm and found Epstein unresponsive in his cell with a ligature around his neck. CPR was initiated, and he was transported to a local ER with resuscitation efforts ongoing.

events.title: Epstein Found with Rope Injury
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell (Special Housing Unit Z05-Cell 124) with a rope around his neck, sitting on the floor. He had a circular line of erythema on his neck and was placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Epstein Medical Evaluation
events.description: Epstein was evaluated by medical staff for complaints including right arm numbness, lack of medications for a week, and sleep issues due to no CPAP machine. New medications and lab tests were ordered.

events.title: Multiple 'BARGE REQUEST' Calls
events.description: A series of 17 telephone calls were made, all with a dialed number '003' and a call status of 'BARGE REQUEST', originating from various inmate stations within the facility.

events.title: Telephone Call Activity Log
events.description: A log of 52 telephone calls made on August 9, 2019, showing detailed call records with timestamps, caller station IDs, and a consistent dialed number '003'.

events.title: Series of 'BARGE REQUEST' Phone Calls
events.description: A sequence of 70+ short-duration phone calls (most lasting 1-3 seconds) are logged throughout the evening, all with a call status of 'BARGE REQUEST' and dialing the number '003'.

events.title: Series of Facility Phone System Calls
events.description: A continuous series of very short-duration telephone calls logged from the facility's phone system, starting in the evening of August 9th and continuing past midnight into August 10th.

events.title: Series of 'Barge Request' Calls
events.description: A continuous series of very short telephone calls (mostly 1-3 seconds) are logged over a period of approximately 28 hours. All calls have a status of 'BARGE REQUEST' and dial the number '003'.

events.title: Telephone Activity Log
events.description: A log of numerous telephone calls made to dialed number '003' throughout the day, with call statuses marked as 'BARGE REQUEST'.

events.title: Telephone Call Log Entries
events.description: System records multiple call connection attempts or audits with status 'BARGE REQUEST' on specific circuits and facilities.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019, at approximately 6:33 AM with 'circumferential bruising around the neck' and posterior mottling.
Correctional Officer T. Noel stated 'we did not complete the 3am nor 5am rounds' regarding cell checks prior to the incident.
Correctional Officer M. Thomas appeared distraught and stated 'we messed up' and 'I messed up... we didn't do any rounds.'
Epstein had made a social phone call to his family (specifically his mother) the evening before his death, on August 9, 2019.
Staff memos indicate planning was underway to assign Epstein a cellmate upon his return from an attorney visit on August 9, suggesting he was not in solitary confinement at that time.
Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York on August 10, 2019, at approximately 6:33 AM.
The incident was extensively documented with photo sheets, many of which were taken by correctional officers Lt. S. and D. S. at 6:49 AM.
Epstein's inmate registration number was 76318-054.
Financial records show Epstein sent $200 to Efrain Reyes on August 7, 2019, and $200 to Ruben Rugard on July 8, 2019, via Western Union from prison.
Some photo sheets indicate photographs were also taken at an 'outside hospital,' suggesting Epstein was transported there after the incident.
Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated at the New York MCC from at least July 6, 2019, with a prison account showing commissary purchases for items like batteries, soap, a radio, and vitamins.

An Administrative Detention Order dated July 10, 2019, states Epstein was placed in detention because his 'continued presence in the general population poses a serious threat' and was 'pending classification.'
Epstein's inmate profile lists his security threat as 'HISTORY OF COMMITTING RAPE' and his charges as 'SEX TRAFFICKING CONSP.' and 'SEX TRAFFICKING OF MINORS.'
Between July and August 2019, Epstein received $700 in his inmate trust account via Western Union from three individuals: Gulnora Tali, Darren K. Indyke, and Richard Kahn.
The records show a very high frequency of attorney visits for Epstein, with nearly daily visits logged throughout July 2019, and a hospital transport on August 10, 2019.
Jeffrey Epstein's BOP medical records detail multiple chronic health conditions including hyperlipidemia, sleep apnea, hypertension, prediabetes, low back pain, and neuralgia.
The records note an 'Injury, unspecified' on July 23, 2019, with the note 'R/O self inflicted injuries' (rule out self-inflicted injuries).
Epstein was prescribed a Medrol dose pack for shooting back pain and was issued a CPAP machine (serial # P11312813B1ED) for his sleep apnea on July 30, 2019.
The documents were generated on August 10, 2019, and include a 'Transfer To' section, suggesting medical preparation for a potential move from the MCC.
Epstein had a fish allergy and was cleared for food service with a lower bunk restriction due to his back pain.
Epstein's medical history included hypertriglyceridemia, sleep apnea, constipation, low back pain, neuralgia, and a past treated chlamydia infection in 2015.

Lab results from July 9-10, 2019, showed elevated cholesterol (216 mg/dL), high triglycerides (413 mg/dL), low HDL (31 mg/dL), and elevated AST (57 U/L), indicating potential metabolic and liver concerns.
Epstein reported extensive foreign travel, including to Paris for three weeks prior to his arrest, and a sexual history of 10+ female partners in the last five years with inconsistent condom use.

He was prescribed multiple medications including docusate sodium, methylprednisolone, omega-3 (Vascepa), milk of magnesia, and insulin, reflecting management of constipation, inflammation, hyperlipidemia, and blood sugar.
Dental records noted Epstein had several missed dental appointments ('call outs') and his screening revealed gingival recession and crowding, with mostly present teeth and no dentures.
On July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell with a rope around his neck and marks of friction/erythema on his neck; custody staff reported the incident and he was placed on suicide watch.
Epstein implicated his cellmate in the neck injury on July 24, 2019, telling medical staff 'I think my room mate had to do with what happened to me' but refused to provide details.
Epstein refused a recommended optometrist (eye doctor) evaluation on July 24, 2019, signing an official Bureau of Prisons treatment refusal form.
Medical records from late July 2019 document Epstein reporting episodes of right arm numbness and loss of control, as well as persistent tingling ('pins and needles').
Lab tests from July 9-10, 2019, showed Epstein had an elevated Hemoglobin A1C level of 6.3, indicating increased risk for diabetes, and a non-reactive HIV test.
Jeffrey Epstein refused multiple recommended medical treatments in July 2019, including a routine chest X-ray and an eye doctor evaluation.
On July 30, 2019, Epstein reported to medical staff that he had been without his medications for about a week and had experienced concerning numbness in his right arm.
Epstein stated he had not slept for three weeks due to lack of access to his CPAP machine for sleep apnea, though he was informed it would be provided.
On August 10, 2019, Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at MCC New York's Special Housing Unit with a ligature around his neck, in cardiac arrest.
Full resuscitation efforts were documented, including CPR, intubation, and administration of epinephrine, before he was transported to a local emergency room.
On July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell with a rope around his neck, resulting in neck marks; he was placed on suicide watch.
Medical notes from July 30, 2019, indicate Epstein reported being without his medications for about a week and experiencing right arm numbness.
Call Detail Records (CDRs) show 17 rapid 'BARGE REQUEST' calls were made on August 9, 2019, all dialing the number '003'.
The medical assessment lists multiple conditions for Epstein including prediabetes, hypertension, sleep apnea, and neuralgia.
Epstein told medical staff he did not know how the neck injury occurred and was uncooperative in discussing the events leading to it.
The document is a telephone call log from August 9, 2019, containing 52 individual call records.
All logged calls have a 'BARGE REQUEST' call status and dialed the number '003', indicating a monitored or controlled calling environment.
The log includes detailed technical telephony data such as caller station numbers, circuit IDs, routing classes, and precise timestamps down to the second.
The log records over 70 phone calls occurring on August 9, 2019, between approximately 6:00 PM and 8:00 PM.
Every call has a status of 'BARGE REQUEST', which typically indicates a third party (like law enforcement or monitoring personnel) joined or attempted to join an ongoing call.
All calls dialed the number '003', suggesting calls were placed to a single, consistent destination or internal extension.
The calls are extremely brief, with most having a duration of only 1-3 seconds, indicating failed connections, instant denials, or automated monitoring attempts.
The log contains technical telephony data including caller station numbers, circuit IDs, and switch information, pointing to an institutional phone system, potentially within a detention facility.
The log records 124 consecutive phone call attempts (Records 89-124) from a facility, all with the status 'BARGE REQUEST' and type 'ONE LINE'.
All calls are extremely brief, with durations typically of 1-2 seconds, indicating failed connections, automated pings, or system monitoring.
The calls span from approximately 8:02 PM on August 9, 2019, to 12:08 AM on August 10, 2019.
The document appears to be a raw system log from a correctional or detention facility's telephone network, based on the formatting and 'BARGE' terminology.
No personal names, conversations, or substantive content is recorded in this log excerpt; it contains only technical connection data.
The log records 159 call entries (Records 125-159 shown) from August 10-11, 2019, with timestamps ranging from 00:08 to 04:49.
Every call has a 'Call Status' of 'BARGE REQUEST', which typically refers to a feature allowing a third party to join an ongoing call, often used in monitoring or supervisory contexts.
All calls dial the number '003', suggesting it is a pre-programmed or internal destination.
The calls are extremely brief, with most lasting only 1-3 seconds, indicating they may be automated system checks, failed connection attempts, or monitoring pings.
The log includes technical telephony data such as caller station IDs, circuit numbers, switch IDs, and routing classes, consistent with an institutional phone system.
The document is a detailed telephone call log dated August 11, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein died in custody.
All calls in the log are directed to the same dialed number: '003'.
The call status for every entry is recorded as 'BARGE REQUEST', which may indicate a specific type of call monitoring or connection request.
The log contains technical telephony data including caller station numbers, circuit IDs, timestamps, and routing information.
No personal names are mentioned in this text chunk; it consists entirely of technical call record data.
The document is a technical telephone call log or system audit record dated August 11, 2019.
Entries show call statuses labeled 'BARGE REQUEST', which may indicate call monitoring or interception attempts.
The log includes detailed technical parameters like circuit numbers, routing classes, trunk groups, and facility IDs.
This record is part of a larger document set (EFTA00050961-EFTA00050962) related to the Epstein investigation.
No named individuals are mentioned in this text fragment; it contains only system data and timestamps.
